page.title: 01PETERLEE,CASTLE EDEN AREA
page.content: This area which lies only 4 kms from the North Sea,is predominately rural, situated in the Easington Rural District of the County of Durham.It is dominated by a local nature reserve called Castle Eden Dene,and it,and the surrounding farmland are bounded by the outskirts of Peterlee New Town,by the village of Castle Eden,Old Shotton,Hesleden and by the old colliery village of Wingate.Once the area's wealth came from mining and heavy industry but their decline has led to an unemployment situation which the new light industry of Peterlee and the established farming has not been able to combat.Many of the population therefore travel to the larger centres of Newcastle,Middlesbrough and Sunderland using the fast,new A19,which acts as an artery for the district.
